Class GameEngine

java.lang.Object
game.GameEngine
public class GameEngine extends Object
This class is part of the "World of Zuul" application. "World of Zuul" is a very simple, text based adventure game. This class creates all rooms, creates the parser and starts the game. It also evaluates and executes the commands that the parser returns.
Version:
1.0 (Jan 2003) DB edited (2019) Christophe TARATIBU modified (2025), 2025/2026 (09.01.2026) Christophe TARATIBU
Author:
Michael Kolling and David J. Barnes

    • alea

      private void alea(Command pCmd)
      Manage the alea command to control random behavior in tests. - alea string: memorizes the string to determine the next random draw - alea: clears the string to allow truly random draws This command should only be used in test mode.
      Parameters:
      pCmd - The command to process

    • interpretCommand

      public void interpretCommand(String pCmdLine)
      Process the command. Return true if the command ends the game, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      pCmdLine - The command to process.

    • testFile

      private void testFile(Command pCommand)
      Launch a test file
      Parameters:
      pCommand - The command to process

    • printHelp

      public void printHelp()
      Print out some help information. Here we print some stupid, cryptic message and a list of the command words.

    • winAndForge

      public void winAndForge(Room pRoom)
      Check if the player has won and forges the blade if so.
      Parameters:
      pRoom - The current room of the player

    • goRooms

      private void goRooms(Command pCmd)
      Go to the room in the given direction. If there is no room in that direction, print an error message.
      Parameters:
      pCmd - the command to process (should contain "go" and a direction).

    • endGame

      public void endGame()
      End the game

    • getCurrentRoomItemNames

      public List<String> getCurrentRoomItemNames()
      Get item names present in the current room (for UI selection)
      Returns:
      array of item names; empty array if none

    • getPlayerItemNames

      public List<String> getPlayerItemNames()
      Get item names present in player's inventory (for UI selection)
      Returns:
      array of item names; empty array if none
